data.title: Wonderful find in Rock Hill
data.text:
This was by far our best breakfast on this trip. Owned by a local chef who spends his time in the kitchen and walking treating his guests. 

The coffee was bold and flavorful not needing any cream, exceptional. We started our brunch with the side sausage gravy and biscuits which has to be the best we've ever had, amazing flavor and flakey perfectly baked biscuits. Next I had the ham, potato, peppers, onion and fantastic seasonings combined as a hash. My better half had the goat cheese, mushroom and bacon omelette with fresh fruit, both meals were exceptional. Our server Jon Michael was attentive, and there when you needed with just a glance in his direction. 

Well done Flipside, I only give a 5 if exceptional in every facet, this is certainly well deserved in my opinion and well worth your time to visit and enjoy.

data.title: Brunch
data.text: Stopped for breakfast/brunch and must say what a great find! Perfectly prepared omelet, sausage gravy was delicious, quick service, overall awesome, I would go out if my way to stop here again for brunch😉

data.title: Birthday disappointment...
data.text: After reviewing the meu, my family was excited to take my Mom there for her birthday dinner.  The appetizers were delicious; we had the pimento cheese, the mushroom ravioli, and the pull-apart cheese bread. Most of the table of 8 ordered burgers which they really enjoyed.  Unfortunately, my Mom, sister, and I ordered the short ribs; they were more like pot roast and bland. Fortunately, we ordered brussel sprouts as an additional side which were delicious!  My sister was in such dismay until she called back to speak with the manager to make sure they served us shortribs, and she assured those were the finest cuts of meat.  We tried to make up for the poor experience by taking her to Amelie's (a quick walk down the sidewalk) for a delectable dessert.

data.title: Ate and Engaged
data.text: We ate here and got engaged right after. Only way I could have done it was with a full stomach. Awesome atmosphere and very very good bar!

data.title: A mixed experience
data.text: The food is good, overly "southern" as so much in the region seems to be these days. As is the case elsewhere, finding a dish without grits, collards, or other southern parody food is a bit of a challenge. But if you want neo-southern food, this is your place. But in the final analysis the food was extremely good and the chef deserves high praise. The problem was that it was very difficult to eat due to the painfully high noise level (Friday evening) that made it not only impossible to converse but necessary to find some way to eat with my hands over my ears. I doubt I'll go back.

data.title: Sloppy joe
data.text: Nice atmosphere. Excellent sloppy joe with fries. All the lunch dishes look good. Can be pricey. Only come when work related as the bill is not on me.

data.title: Panini
data.text: Went here for lunch during the week.  Wasn't crowded.  Sat at the bar and had good service.  Had the Italian panini and it was excellent.  Soft pretzel bread...wow...!  Had a side salad as well.  Very fresh!  And house dressing very good!  Looked like they had some good craft beers on tap as well.  I'll go back.

data.title: Interesting and ecelectic menu in Rock Hill
data.text: My wife and I have debated about going here, and really went in on a whim.  We sat at the bar, since the restaurant was full.  The bartender was attentive and the food was excellent.  I felt that the wine list was somewhat over priced for the area, but other that that, a very nice dining experience.

data.title: Eat Local
data.text: We have eaten here a few times and really is wonderful fare. The staff is always very nice and makes good recommendations. Cannot go wrong with just about anything. The menu changes regularly which is always nice but also a bummer when to really like an item. Good atmosphere but can get rather loud with a full house.

data.title: Off Night?
data.text: Maybe we just had an off night at this establishment because it was highly recommended by our inn keeper and we liked the ambience.    We decided to share the pork entree which would have been great if it hadn't been overcooked.   Our side salads were good though.    We saw other tables with bread but we weren't offered.   Our server was not very communicative and seemed distracted.      We could have addressed our issues with management but it was late and we had traveled a long way that day so we didn't want to bother.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Was a very cute area. Bread and butter was great. Staff very good and helpful and friendly. Food was just ok... we would try again if we were to return to this area. Had great reviews but wasn't what we expected? But again... staff was friendly and helpful.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: This is a newer and larger version of the Flipside Cafe in Fort Mill. Celebrated owner/chefs Jon and Amy Fortes have two wonderful spots.  Emphasis is on upscale Southern food with downhome atmosphere. The short ribs were huge, tender and tasty. New York Strip was excellent. The sides were rich and delicious. Mushroom soup was thick and creamy. Bundling an appetizer, entree and dessert was well worth the $32 for what we ordered.

data.title: Downtown Rock Hill SC has a real gem!
data.text: Part of a very small "chain" of two locally owned restaurants, TFR is the bigger-brother of the two, serving excellent Southern staples in a quaint renovated setting.  The food was flavorful, well seasoned, and well presented; appetizer, entree, and dessert options were all very good.  A reasonable number of adult beverage options were available to complement the food.  For the downtown area of Rock Hill SC, prices were on the high side, though not excessively so; service was a bit slow for us as well even as the evening approached a Saturday closing time.  However, the food is the attraction here, and is well worth a trip!

data.title: Great food/wonderful place for brunch
data.text: We eat here often for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The food is always delicious.  They have interesting cocktails you may not find at other restaurants.  I definitely recommend this one!

data.title: Good quality in downtown RH
data.text: Solid choice for business or casual lunch in Old Town.  Not fancy but good quality food and friendly atmosphere.  Craving sprouts.

data.title: Cute place but needs faster service
data.text: Foods pretty good and the people there are nice but the service is too slow. They either need to get their people in gear or hire more. Drinks and food are expensive and there are never any special prices.

data.title: Wow.  What a great breakfast!
data.text:
Had Saturday brunch here and will be back to try lunch or dinner.  I had the chiliquile. Amazing.  Crispy baked tortillas covered in chorizo, a wonderful sauce and fried eggs.  My husband had the flipside breakfast, a sampling of lots of things.  There was more food than we could eat.  Ambiance was unexpectedly inviting.  Prices fair, 10.00 per entree.  Server, John Michael was wonderful.  Learning it was our first visit, he brought us lunch and dinner menus to review and offered excellent recommendations.   

This was a great experience that we did not expect to find on a side street!  Try this place out!

data.title: Flipside Restaurant--name says it all
data.text: Service is good, lets you have conversation and visit between order and service.  Food quality is very good tasting and is served with a flair that makes you want to taste it.

data.title: Great place in downtown!
data.text: Have eaten here several times. Great place for a date night or a Girls Night Out!  Food is excellent.  Brussel sprouts are yummy.  Shrimp and grits are just awesome and served in a hot dish!  Service has been great.  Nice addition to downtown Rock Hill.

data.title: Dining at Flipside
data.text:
I've been to the Flipside 3 times for lunch.  Always good service and good food.
They are responsive to your comments with fast service.  Open area, noise level okay, but not sure about a large business group for hearing everyone.
